class ErrorMatrixThread

Detailed Description

View displaying the Error Matrix.

Each element in the matrix indicates how likely it is that the two clusters corresponding to the row and column of the element contain spikes from the same neuron. This view is part of the Grouping Assistant View which contains also a ClusterView, a WaveformView and a CorrelationView. A click on one of the elements of the matrix display the corresponding clusters in the others views. This view is not automatically updated when the clusters are changed.

Author:
Lynn Hazan
Since:
klusters 1.1

int  newClusterId

Updates the error matrix drawing by adding a red border if the rearrangement of clusters have modified clusters presented in the matrix.

Parameters:

int  destinationCluster 
) [slot]

Parameters:
deletedClusters list of clusters having been deleted
destinationCluster cluster with which the clusters in deletedClusters are merge (cluster 0 or 1 cluster of artefact and cluster of noise respectively).

int  destinationClusterId,

Parameters:
fromClusters list of clusters from which the spikes have been taken.
destinationClusterId cluster id to which the spikes have been added
emptiedClusters list clusters numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.

QValueList< int > &  emptiedClusters 
) [slot]

Updates the error matrix drawing by adding a red border if the clusters presented in the matrix have been modified to create the new clusters.

Parameters:
fromToNewClusterIds map where the keys are ids of the clusters which really contained spikes in the region and the values are the ids of the newly created clusters.
emptiedClusters list clusters numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.

QValueList< int > &  modifiedClusters,
bool  isModifiedByDeletion,

) [slot]

deletedClusters list of clusters which were deleted.
